title: Tim Jacobs (American football)
text:
Timothy Jacobs, Jr. (born April 5, 1970) is a former <a href="American%20football">American football</a> <a href="cornerback">cornerback</a> who played for five seasons in the <a href="National%20Football%20League">National Football League</a> (NFL). After playing <a href="college%20football">college football</a> for the <a href="Delaware%20Fightin%27%20Blue%20Hens%20football">Delaware Fightin' Blue Hens</a>, he was signed by the <a href="Cleveland%20Browns">Cleveland Browns</a> as an <a href="undrafted%20free%20agent">undrafted free agent</a> in 1993. He played for the Browns from 1993–1995 and the <a href="Miami%20Dolphins">Miami Dolphins</a> from 1996–1997.
Professional career.
Cleveland Browns.
Jacobs signed with the <a href="Cleveland%20Browns">Cleveland Browns</a> as an <a href="undrafted%20free%20agent">undrafted free agent</a> following the <a href="1993%20NFL%20Draft">1993 NFL Draft</a>. He was released prior to the start of the <a href="1993%20NFL%20season">1993 season</a>, but re-signed with the team and played in two games, recording one <a href="Tackle%20%28football%20move%29">tackle</a>. As a backup cornerback in <a href="1994%20NFL%20season">1994</a>, Jacobs recorded two interceptions, including one against <a href="Drew%20Bledsoe">Drew Bledsoe</a> of the <a href="New%20England%20Patriots">New England Patriots</a>. He played in 10 games in 1994, recording one <a href="Starting%20lineup">start</a> and six tackles. He was re-signed to a one-year contract on July 21, 1995. After he was beaten by <a href="Buffalo%20Bills">Buffalo Bills</a> <a href="wide%20receiver">wide receiver</a> <a href="Andre%20Reed">Andre Reed</a> for a 41-yard touchdown on October 2, Jacobs was deactivated the next game. He compiled 23 tackles in the 14 games he played in 1995.
Miami Dolphins.
Jacobs signed with the <a href="Miami%20Dolphins">Miami Dolphins</a> in June 1996. He played in 12 games in <a href="1996%20NFL%20season">1996</a>, forcing two <a href="fumble">fumble</a>s and making 10 tackles. In <a href="1997%20NFL%20season">1997</a>, he played in all 16 games for the Dolphins (starting one), and had 15 tackles. He was re-signed to a one-year contract on April 25, 1998, but was released on August 26, 1998.
